schema.description:
SCIM User resource as defined in RFC 7643 Section 4.1.
Represents a user account in the system.

active.description:
Indicates the user's administrative status.
Typically true means able to log in, false means account suspended

addresses.description: Physical mailing addresses for the user

country.description: The country name in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format

formatted.description: The full mailing address, formatted for display

postalCode.description: The zip code or postal code component

primary.description: Indicates if this is the primary address

type.description: The type of address (work, home, other)

displayName.description: The name of the user, suitable for display to end-users

display.description: A human-readable name for the email address

primary.description: Indicates if this is the primary email address

type.description: The type of email address (work, home, other)

externalId.description:
Identifier for the user as defined by the provisioning client.
Allows the client to maintain their own identifier.

groups.description: Groups to which the user belongs

$ref.description: The URI of the corresponding Group resource

display.description: A human-readable name for the group

id.description:
Unique identifier for the user. Assigned by the service provider.
MUST be unique across the entire set of resources. Immutable.

locale.description:
The user's default location for purposes of localizing items such as
currency and date/time format. Valid value is a language tag as defined in RFC 5646

meta.description: Resource metadata as defined in RFC 7643 Section 3.1

created.description: The timestamp when the resource was created

lastModified.description: The timestamp when the resource was last modified

resourceType.description: The name of the resource type (e.g., User, Group)

version.description:
The version of the resource. Used for ETag-based versioning.
Weak ETags are prefixed with W/

meta.title: ResourceMetadata

name.description: The components of the user's name

familyName.description: The family name (last name) of the user

formatted.description: The full name, including all middle names, titles, and suffixes

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of the user

honorificPrefix.description: The honorific prefix(es) of the user (e.g., Ms., Dr.)

honorificSuffix.description: The honorific suffix(es) of the user (e.g., III, Jr.)

middleName.description: The middle name(s) of the user

nickName.description: The casual way to address the user

password.description:
The user's cleartext password. Used for setting or changing passwords.
MUST NOT be returned by service provider. Write-only.

display.description: A human-readable name for the phone number

primary.description: Indicates if this is the primary phone number

type.description: The type of phone number (work, home, mobile, fax, pager, other)

value.description: The phone number in E.164 format (e.g., tel:+1-201-555-0123)

preferredLanguage.description:
The user's preferred written or spoken languages.
Format as defined in RFC 7231 Section 5.3.5

profileUrl.description: A URI pointing to the user's online profile

schemas.description: The schema URIs that define this resource

timezone.description: The user's time zone in IANA Time Zone database format

title.description: The user's title, such as Vice President

userName.description:
Unique identifier for the user, typically used for authentication.
Often the user's email address. REQUIRED. Case insensitive.

userType.description:
Identifies the relationship between the organization and the user.
Typical values: Contractor, Employee, Intern, Temp, External

schema.title: User

Location.description: The URL of the newly created user

schema.description: Error response as defined in RFC 7644 Section 3.12

status.description: The HTTP status code expressed as a JSON string

schema.title: ErrorResponse

400.description: Request is unparsable, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema

schema.description: Error response as defined in RFC 7644 Section 3.12

status.description: The HTTP status code expressed as a JSON string

schema.title: ErrorResponse

401.description: Authorization failure. The authorization header is invalid or missing

schema.description: Error response as defined in RFC 7644 Section 3.12

status.description: The HTTP status code expressed as a JSON string

schema.title: ErrorResponse

403.description: Operation is not permitted based on the supplied authorization

schema.description: Error response as defined in RFC 7644 Section 3.12

status.description: The HTTP status code expressed as a JSON string

schema.title: ErrorResponse

409.description:
The specified version number does not match the resource's latest version number,
or a service provider refused to create a new, duplicate resource

schema.description: Error response as defined in RFC 7644 Section 3.12

status.description: The HTTP status code expressed as a JSON string

schema.title: ErrorResponse
